intro: Conostomium kenyense var. subglabrum, commonly known as the Kenyan conostomium, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lanceolate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The subspecies subglabrum is distinguished by its reduced pubescence compared to other varieties.
